meanings.definition: A practice or interest followed for a time with exaggerated zeal.
meanings.sent1: Her faddism for collecting stickers lasted only a week.
meanings.sent2: The faddism for wearing bell-bottoms in the 70s quickly faded.
meanings.sent3: His faddism for eating only green foods was quite amusing to his friends.
meanings.sent4: The faddism of extreme couponing swept through the neighborhood like a storm.
meanings.sent5: The faddism of pet rocks in the 70s became a quirky part of pop culture.

meanings.definition: The quality of being a passing fashion.
meanings.sent1: The faddism of neon colors in fashion changed every season.
meanings.sent2: In the world of technology, faddism can make gadgets obsolete quickly.
meanings.sent3: The faddism of wearing socks with sandals is quite amusing to some people.
meanings.sent4: Her style was a faddism, always changing with the latest trends.
meanings.sent5: The faddism of skinny jeans eventually gave way to looser fits.
